chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark F Magazu

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 27, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains in effect.

2:30 PM Defendant Mark F Magazu appeared by video.  Attorney Hannah M Stewart appeared by video for Mark F Magazu.  Prosecuting attorney Aleksandra Hodowany in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense waives right to Prelim. Court verifies with defendant he is agreeing to have Waiver over zoom.  Defendant indicates he agrees. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Status conference scheduled for December 27, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Atty Stewart Request to Appear Via Zoom.  Okay  DLW
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:27 PM Defendant Mark F Magazu appeared by video.  Attorney Hannah M Stewart appeared by video for Mark F Magazu.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions what status is.  Atty Stewart requests a prelim, requests defendant able to appear by zoom. State believes 1/2 hour sufficient.  Court grants request for defendant to appear by zoom.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference on September 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Mark F Magazu
Current: 402 S Kings Hwy, Cushing, OK 74023 United States  (Effective: 07-11-2022)
Prior: 500 Rs County Road 3378, Emory, TX 75440

10:04 AM Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark F Magazu appeared by video.  Attorney Hannah M Stewart in court for Mark F Magazu. Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.  Defense waives time limits for prelim. Court finds waiver being made freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Letter to Judge Weber RE request for Zoom
Emails between Deputy Clerk of Court and Atty Stewart in regards to refusal hearing.
Cash bond posted by Mark Magazu.

No contact direct or indirect with Deputy E. Williams except in an official capacity.Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.

1:00 PM Mark Magazu appeared by video form the Door County Jail.  Nicholas Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Shannon Viel appeared by video for Mark Magazu. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Defendant requests break out room with Atty Viel.  Atty Viel gives argument on bond. Atty Viel indicates defendant may be retaining private counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return
